reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived at the hotel without the necessary information to check in, the staff, Marsha and Lynda, were most helpful in assisting me to obtain the details I needed. We found all the staff very friendly and helpful, especially the two named above and Angelo in the restaurant. Good place to stay for visits to Greenwich Park, Maritime Museum, Cutty Sark etc. Also not too far from central London if you are planning to go there during your stay as we did. The DLR (Docklands Light Railway) is very efficient and takes about 20 minutes to get to the City, (Bank station), the DLR station in Greenwich is within a 10 minute walk of the hotel. Hotel has only been open just over a year and very well run by staff who enjoy their jobs. Would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: A warm and friendly welcome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Needed to be near to the West End, but in a hotel with secure parking.
reviews.title: A truly excellent hotel in a convenient location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This very modern newish Premier Inn in Greenwich High Road had the benefit of reasonable, secure, basement parking, a restaurant, and an easy walk to Greenwich centre, stations and buses.
reviews.title: excellent service and accomodation

reviews.text: Our booked room (507) looked out on a service well, so we were quickly and easily moved to another, larger room (418) overlooking the Dome, at no extra cost.
reviews.title: Very friendly service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the staff were hugely efficient and helpful, and the restaurant was good, both for breakfast and in the evening.
reviews.title: Could have been a better nights sleep tho

reviews.text: Premier Inn is my crash pad of choice when travelling on business, and this one is no big exception. It is conveniently situated less than five minutes walk from either Greenwich or Depford Bridge DLR stops, and there's even a direct bus to Marylebone High Street!
reviews.title: Decent, Quiet, Good Sleep and not much else

reviews.text: Located in a modern building, this Premier Inn is well kept, very friendly, and like most Premier Inns, beds and bedding are of good quality and a good nights sleep is guaranteed - or so the hotel promises. They certainly lived up to that.
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay.

reviews.text: Deptford is a very nice, real old London area to stay in, with traditional pubs, old shops, cheap cafes - get there quickly before the hipsters move in. Its also ok for Central London, and the O2 and ExCel are just a short hop away. Try the excellent Vietnamese restaurants in Deptford High Street if you can, or a really old school cafe, Bianca's, in Deptford High Street.
reviews.title: Ideal for a Greenwich visit.

reviews.text: Spent 3 nights at the hotel whilst visiting the area. Good quality rooms and furnishings and pleasant staff made our visit very enjoyable. Location was good and we loved Greenwich village, great atmosphere.
reviews.title: wonderful staff

reviews.text: Would recommend and stay again.
reviews.title: Really friendly hotel with amazing helpful staff

reviews.text: I am currently staying in this hotel for 3 nights. I have to say this hotel is excellent, staff are so friendly, bedrooms are great quality beds are very comfy. Restuarant food is fantastic and staff great to get on with. DLR trains are great and get u about in no time. Definitely recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: Very nice hotel in a quiet location that was great value for money. The room was very clean and had everything i needed in there. Bathroom was very clean and had clean towels daily if needed.
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.text: the hotel had a very good restaurant and bar on site which was good value for money.
reviews.title: THE WAITER SWORE AT ME! SHOCKING!
Great Hotel for Exploring Greenwich
reviews.text: would stay here again .

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really nice place easy access! The bar and restraunt service was the worst ive had, ever! I ordered 1 drink and it took about an hour to come, apart from that the hotel and the meal was lovely, but i wont be returning to that premier in, you have put a bad impression on the premier inn branch! Really shocking service, the waiter was extremely rude to me, i asked for my drinks after waiting half an hour and he snapped back at me saying,THERE COMING! I heard him say for f**k sake under his breath, which is appoling, i hope you friered him, because we wern't the only ones complaing at him!
reviews.title: ideal for the O2
average
reviews.text: I stayed there for two nights. No complain.
The room was quite small, but clean and quiet. If you just need to sleep, it is good enough.
reviews.title: Up to the usual decent, predictable standard of Premier Inn

reviews.text: The breakfast was nothing wow, but just normal English breakfast. Staffs were friendly and nice.
reviews.title: Excellent value, excellent hotel

reviews.text: We stayed here for three nights while attending our daughter's acceptance into the Law Society ceremony in London; I booked two rooms which cost a total of £370 for the 3-nights. It was up to the usual decent standard of most Premier Inns; nice, clean and functional with no frills. They provided free ice for the room, in an ice-bucket from the bar. We arrived at 10 p.m. on the Thu night and the restaurant was closed so we got excellent fish and chips from the Golden Chippy across the street, run by a very friendly Turkish-Cypriot who has owned the chip shop for over 30 years! As a consequence, we did not have any meals in the restaurant as we had restaurant/market plans for all the following days/nights. The hotel is only a 5 minute walk to Deptford Bridge DLR station (there is also a Tesco Express just to the left of the Travelodge there for water, drinks and snacks) or about 7 minutes in the other direction up Greenwich High Road to Greenwich DLR/Rail Station so very handy from that perspective. However, unless you intend extensively exploring south of the Thames and Greenwich/Blackheath in particular, consider staying in a Premier Inn or other suitable priced hotel closer to the city as it does take quite a time to get to/from here if most of your time will be spend in central London. It is only 8 mins by rail to London Bridge which is the stop for the Shard and more importantly HMS Belfast and Borough Market and this train also goes to Cannon St Station, in central London so it's not too bad but does add journey time. Other than that, I would recommend it.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.text: Very comfortable, close to the DLR, rooms are roomy, breakfast is excellent.
reviews.title: Just 'OK'
